attributes.action: The immediate expulsion of all Israeli diplomats and sanctions against Israel.
attributes.background: The atrocities taking place in Gaza needs to be brought to the attention of the government. Israel needs to be held accountable for its actions against innocent people.

attributes.action: UK public to vote on any military action
attributes.background: The UK government get involved in military action again and yet no member of the UK public voted or have any choice if they use our tax pounds to pay for it or indeed even to get involved. #notinmyname

attributes.action: Make interest on student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background: Currently, the interest we pay on student loans is not tax deductible. Every year, 6.1% interest is charged on our student loan balance. Assuming we finish university £40,000 in debt, we have £2,440 a year of interest payments to make before we are even able to reduce our principal balance.
attributes.additional_details: Under the current system, you would have to earn about £52,111 just to be able to pay every year the interest on your balance (assuming you have £40,000 debt). The government then charges you 40% tax on your interest payment, costing you £976 a year. Assuming you earn £52,111; you are paying the government £3,416 (976+2440) a year for borrowing their money (without decreasing your balance). Corporation have tax-deduction on their interest payments, so should students.

attributes.action: Reduce knife and gun crime with deterrent sentences
attributes.background:
10 yrs minimum for carrying a knife 
20 yrs minimum for using a knife 

20yrs minimum for carrying a gun
40yrs minimum for using a gun

All without parole.
attributes.additional_details:
The current sentences that the judiciary are handing out are obviously not deterrent enough

Act now !

Save lives !

attributes.action: Place Mindfulness in to the UK school Curriculum
attributes.background: As a family fitness business we see the importance in health and well-being and we see a huge gap in a healthy mentality amongst children and adults too. We believe that by placing an extra subject in to the uk school curriculum this would benefit the future generations massively.
attributes.additional_details: Good health comes from a healthy fitness level, healthy diet and a healthy mindset. A lot of thought and action has gone in to improving school children’s outlook on sport and fitness, as well as nutrition but the mentality of this young generation is still pretty untouched.

attributes.action: Request for help and assist for serious flood situation Kerala, India,
attributes.background: This petition on behalf of Malayalies in UK and their families and friends in Kerala included among the 35 Million, the southern state of India. Death toll is rising every hour, every minute. More than 250,000 people have fled their homes.The aged, young, ill and pregnant are stranded.
attributes.additional_details:
All the shutters of 36 of the 39 reservoirs have been open and it was continuously and heavily raining for the past one week.

We beg for mercy in front of the whole world, we need help

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-45216671

https://www.facebook.com/johnygeorge.kalathiparambil/videos/1830622453700580/UzpfSTEwMDAwNTE3MDcxNDIwNDoxMDY3Nzk3ODk2NzM1ODkx/
https://news.sky.com/world
https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/asia/kerala-flood-death-rise-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Make Escort Vehicles Carry Highways Agency Code Of Practice Mandatory.
attributes.background:
I would like the Highways Agency Code of Practice for Escort Vehicles markings and lighting made mandatory.
I am increasingly observing so called Escort Vehicles without adequate safety warning markings front or rear including width of vehicle lighting.
I doubt they are fully insured or equipped.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am describing does not make a good Escort Operator but does bring a more safety conscious driver to the mind of the motoring public therefore safety becomes more paramount. If you like, wearing a uniform describes our profession at a glance. 
There are many of us who adhere to this practice including the equipment we should be carrying for emergency or breakdown and can be found on social media where we share some experiences.

attributes.action: Make creative writing an A level subject again.
attributes.background:
Creative writing should be an A level subject as it is just as difficult as any others. For young people who want to become writers , their options at A level limit them.
Creative writing A level is fun and a way to get young people’s imaginations sparked in today’s society.

attributes.action: Stop animals being given away as prizes or sold at funfairs.
attributes.background: Carnival fish are often kept in poor conditions in small bags. These bags become very hot on warm days and will run out of oxygen. They're given without any advice on how to care for them. Goldfish live on average 5-10 years in captivity however carnival fish often die shortly after being given.

attributes.action: Make gender-neutral passports available for British citizens
attributes.background: The UK government currently allows only 'M'/'F' gender markers on travel documents, which effectively erases many non-binary and intersex people. I would urge the government to recognise these already marginalised groups.
attributes.additional_details:
In a recent dispute the high court was told gender-neutral passports would affect legislation, be prohibitively expensive and increase the need for consular support for British citizens.

None of which negates the fact that we still need them, whatever the cost, and that if legislation doesn't account for non-binary and intersex people, it badly needs revising.
 
Gender-neutral passports are already recognised internationally. Ten countries currently offer a third gender option, 'X', or unknown.

attributes.action: Mandate a 50% reduction in all rail fares until normal service is resumed.
attributes.background: The new timetable introduced on 20/05/18 led to massive disruption to journeys. It is the passenger's responsibility to claim delay repay. It would be fairer for all concerned if the ticket price was reduced by 50% until 95% of timetabled services arrived within one minute of the scheduled time

attributes.action: Allow individuals with  Coeliac Disease to join the British Armed Forces
attributes.background: Currently you cannot join any British Armed Forces with Coeliac Disease as it may affect operational ability. Vegetarian/ Halal diets are provided- but no GF. Coeliacs can be asymptomatic and with a GF diet would be an asset to the Armed Forces. Refusal to supply a Gluten Free diet is discriminatory
attributes.additional_details:
The Israeli Army has started supplying Gluten Free diets to it's soldiers proving it possible.Refusal to provide a GF catering option in the UK  Forces is discriminatory. Coeliac sufferers  should be assessed on an individual basis when applying to enlist. There is an undisclosed number of serving personnel,diagnosed following enlistment - some required early discharge 
/ medical downgrading - but many who continue active service. Exact numbers unknown as previous FOI requests were rejected

attributes.action: All chewing gum sold in the UK from 2023 must be easy to remove from paths.
attributes.background: Chewing gum defaces public paths, blocks toilets and damages clothes, and cleaning costs a huge amount. This proposal gives manufacturers a realistic time to improve their formula.
attributes.additional_details: The LGA estimates the annual cost of removing pieces trodden into pavements across England has reached £56 million, with around six tons dropped in the West End of London alone each year. It claimed that while the average piece of gum costs about 3p to buy, local authorities have to spend around £1.50 to clean it up. (This estimate: 22 Nov 2014)

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time - and they don't consider Volunteering and Work Placement experience as valuable: only formal, paid employment experience within the previous 6 months will suffice. 

This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods, claiming benefits for far longer than they want to, and open to harassment from Job Centre staff and the media.

attributes.action: Cancel fees for children born in UK before their parents acquired settlement
attributes.background: Children born in UK whose parents were not settled at the time have to pay £1,012 to register them as British citizens is disproportionate and wrong. Assuming  parents who have three kids before acquiring  settlement or becoming a British citizens have to pay over £3,036.
attributes.additional_details:
HOME OFFICE FEES WITH EFFECT FROM 6 APRIL 2018 FOR CITIZENSHIP APPLICATIONS AND THE RIGHT OF 
ABODE:
CHILDREN
 B(OTA), B(OS) EM, MN1, S2, S3, T.
Child under 18 applying to register as a British citizen 
**An additional £80 per applicant is required to cover the ceremony fee should 
the child turn 18 during the application process. This will be required at point of 
decision.

Fees:£1012

attributes.action: Britain should apologize for forced conscription in her West African colonies.
attributes.background: During WWII, Her Majesty’s Government forcefully conscripted young men from the former British West African colonies of the Gold Coast (now Ghana), Nigeria, Sierra Leone and the Gambia to fight against the Axis powers. It is estimated that the West African colonies supplied over 240,000 soldiers.
attributes.additional_details:
They experienced racial, and other forms, of discrimination compared to British soldiers. Tens of thousands of West African troops were killed in action or died of disease. Their families received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration. Many of those who survived returned home from the frontlines with combat-related Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration.
Please visit www.westafricaapology.com for further details.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic film wrappers that are not biodegradable.
attributes.background: Many plastic film wrappers such as those used when mailing magazines, are not biodegradable. Yet materials that could replace such wrappers are readily available. The existing wrappers cause, at the very least, an eye-sore when blown around our countryside. At the extreme they kill wild creatures.

attributes.action: Proportional charge for all Governmental Fixed Penalty Notices and Fines.
attributes.background: We, the signed, call on the government to implement the same policy that is already practiced by  governments in other european countries such as Denmark and Iceland in which Fines are charged to a proportion of the offenders income. This way punishment is same for all, as it is meant to be in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Think about it this way 2 people walking down the road both drop litter and are given a fixed penalty notice of £80. The first person comes from a household earning £200 a week and the other £200 a day. This is not a fair measure, this nearly 7x worse for the person who can afford it the least.

A proportional system means both parties receive the same impact and that impact can be kept from being up to half the weekly income of people who are potentially facing growing poverty.

attributes.action: Launch a National Consultation on Reducing Plastic Usage
attributes.background: Blue Planet 2 has started a national talk on reducing plastic usage, we need to start reducing the hidden plastics in retailers, e.g. Plastic cutlery, wrapping around magazines, DVDs, CDs, Cigarettes etc. A national consultation is needed with companies to reduce the usage of plastics.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to pay into the 'Teachers' Pension'.
attributes.background: Supply teachers cannot pay into the Teachers' Pension. If you are contracted for 2 hours a week you can opt-in, but as a supply teacher working 5 days a week you can't. Why? Because supply agencies don't employ us, so can't pay the employer's contribution. The ethics of agencies are another debate.
attributes.additional_details: Supply teachers used to be employed by LEAs. They were paid to scale, had pay progression and a pension. Successive governments have turned a blind eye to agencies taking this role where supply teachers are not paid to scale, have no pay progression and have no pension. A supply teacher will earn £16000 a year if they work every school day (the agencies having got £29,250 for that teacher). Some things we have to accept: the government signing our pension away, we shouldn't have to.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to state pension age back to 65 for men and 60 for women
attributes.background: I started paying into the N.I. system aged 16 when the retirement age was stated as 65 for men and 60 for women. I’ve been full time employed since then and have had the terms of the state pension age changed without consultation. Stand up and stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Look at the gov.uk website for the state pension change and what it means to you. You can get a personal projection so you can see how this new scheme will affect you personally.

attributes.action: An additional £350 million/week must go to the NHS or hold a second referendum
attributes.background: The UK was made to believe that an additional £350 million per week would go to the NHS due to savings directly caused by leaving the EU. If this does not happen the country was lied to by politicians & the vote is therefore invalid. A second Brexit referendum must be held based on detailed facts.

attributes.action: Increase fines for leaving animals in cars
attributes.background: Increase fines to £5000 and be banned from keeping dogs for life

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to upload ID when opening a new social media account
attributes.background: Uploading ID and proof of address when creating a new social media account in order to identify a person and to cut down on fake accounts and trolling. If we can identify who is behind a social media account maybe there wouldn’t be as much trolling.
attributes.additional_details: Social media has become very negative in the last 5 years and people of all ages feel pressured to be a certain way and to act happy even though deep down they could be in great pain. It is easy to put on a front to followers and people don’t feel they can talk to anybody about the way they are feeling because they have to come across a certain way to people they do not know.

attributes.action: Bring AS exams back and rid of A Level exams for the sake of youth mental health
attributes.background: AS exams have been dwindled away due to Michael Gove’s, former education secretary, reforms to A-Level exams. Previously, students would learn a years worth of content and then take the exam, now majority of exams are taken after the 2 year course. A Level exams are also getting harder
attributes.additional_details:
This pressure and strain leads to mental health issues such as anxiety, panic, emotional distress and depression to name a few. The calls mental health organizations receive have been increasing significantly over the years, leaving some dropping out of sixth form altogether in hand reducing teenagers motivation

To say these issues can be eradicated by ridding of the linear style would be inaccurate but it can surely reduce it and make the A-Level process much easier and more controllable.

attributes.action: Create a fairer child maintenance payment for all
attributes.background: Child maintenance is calculated on Gross Pay, rather than Net income. What you are paid and what you take home are very different amounts. Based on Gross, you pay far more child maintenance than you can afford.
attributes.additional_details: Paying on your net pay (what you actually see in your bank account) would mean you pay a fair amount of child maintenance. Not a hugely inflated figure, but a right and just amount.

attributes.action: Make it a legal licensing requirement for minimum x2 doorstaff on any venue
attributes.background: Too many venues are putting doorstaff at risk by requiring only 1 door supervisor. I believe like many other security operatives that there should be a minimum requirement of 2 doorstaff for the health and safety of patrons and staff.

attributes.action: Cancel the franchise for Great Western Railways
attributes.background:
Continuous delays, overcrowding on the new trains with carriages locked to customers due to lack of staff, poor announcements to inform of delays. Lack of empathy to customers. 
Total disregard to season ticket holders with little or no compensation available.

attributes.action: Reinstate - Bring Back the Right of Appeal for UK Family Visit Visas
attributes.background: The basic Right of Appeal was brought in in 2000 for relatives wishing to visit their families in the United Kingdom whose visa applications were refused. That safety-net was suddenly abolished without proper consultation.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the then Government quietly and suddenly abolished that basic right of appeal and safety net for UK citizens whose relatives from time to time wishing to visit family in the United Kingdom. Since it was abolished, refusals have increased by two folds. Please help get this government to do the right thing and bring back this very basic of rights for immediate family members who in most cases are currently being refused without reason.

attributes.action: Give children under the age 18 the right to 10 days education free a year
attributes.background: I am a mother of a child recently starting the educational cycle, hoping for children's attendance to be the right of the parents, rather than the school having the final say in what our children can and cannot do. Hope I have opened people's eyes and can make a change.
attributes.additional_details: It is acceptable for a school to exclude a child for 2 weeks for bad behaviour, however it is not acceptable for parents to take a child on holiday for 7 days. These are our own children we are raising, It is a right of the parents to have the final say with attendance, with input from the educational side -  Not the other way around.  Please sign this petition and change the education system for families to better the lives of their children. Many endless thanks.

attributes.action: Ban horse racing
attributes.background: Horses are whipped and forced to run around tracks that are often made of hard-packed dirt at speeds of more than 30 miles per hour while carrying people on their backs. Racehorses are the victims of a multibillion-dollar industry that has problems with drug abuse, injuries and race fixing.
attributes.additional_details: When they stop winning races or become injured, some owners don’t want to pay for a horse who doesn’t bring in any money. Many end up in slaughterhouses where they are turned into dog food and glue. They may endure days of transport in tiny trailers where there is no access to water, food and injuries are common. Horses tend to thrash about in order to avoid being shot by the gun, which is supposed to render them unconscious before their throats are cut.

attributes.action: Make mandatory that vehicle manufacturers install remotely activated immobiliser
attributes.background: To assist with vehicles that 'fail to stop' for police and being used as weapons in terror attacks, all vehicles should be fitted with remotely activated immobilisers which can be activated by authorities or owners if thier vehicle is stolen or used in crime.
attributes.additional_details: This will help prevent the many deaths we have seen in police pursuits and vehicles being used as weapons in recent terror attacks.

attributes.action: The emergency SMS number 112 should be advertised on TV by the government.
attributes.background: The emergency SMS number 112 is a very useful alternative emergency services number to 999.  It is a number that also works across Europe and most countries worldwide. In training sessions for Basic Life Support it is clear that most people have never hear of its key properties.
attributes.additional_details: The properties of the emergency number 112 needs to be advertised by the UK government in a television information campaign on BBC. The advantages of 112 are that it is a GPS service.  People who are trying to contact emergency services do not need to know where they are as the 112 service can pin point their location.  Also, people can register their phone number to text an emergency message to 112.  This is crucial in areas where a phone signal is not possible.  The text will get through.

attributes.action: Fund the provision of support dogs for assault or abuse survivors with PTSD.
attributes.background: The government could fund and support charities to be able to specifically help the availability of these dogs for sexual assault or domestic violence survivors instead the charities allowing only war veterans to obtain a emotional support dog in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Studies have shown that 20 percent of soldiers come home for war with PTSD however they've also shown that out of all sexual assault, rape or domestic violence survivors that 30 percent have PTSD. Studies have also proved that 82 percent of people (in the USA) with an emotional support dog had a reduction in symptoms like anxiety attacks and nightmares than before and 40 percent reported that they reduced their use of medication. The impacts of these dogs is astronomical to someone's daily life.

attributes.action: Make local Authorities pay for injuries caused by neglect of public path/roads
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that local authorities pay compensation/vet fees for anyone/thing that is injuried due to them not maintaining public footpaths/roads/footbridges correctly.
attributes.additional_details: My dog had two claws ripped out from the root due to the local authorities neglect by not maintaining public footbridges correctly. The bridge had been covered by metal sheeting on top of rotten boards, over time and use the metal sheeting has come loose and moved resulting in my dogs claws becoming traped between levels resulting in two claws being ripped out. The local authority failed to compensate/pay vet fees even tho they carried out urgent repair work. Why should we and our pets suffer.

attributes.action: Form a Government of National Unity to oversee Brexit
attributes.background: Following the resignation of Neville Chamberlain in 1940, a cross-party government of national unity was formed with Churchill as PM and Attlee as deputy PM.  The U.K. is facing a similar national emergency now, and we need a similar remedy now.
attributes.additional_details:
Wikipedia entry on Churchill/Attlee Wartime Administration. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Churchill_war_ministry

attributes.action: Make people with long-term medical conditions exempt from paying for medication
attributes.background: I am a young person suffering with a long term medical condition, there are many other people like me that need medication to prevent them from getting unwell. Due to medical exemption guidelines set out by the NHS Business Authority, we are having to pay £8.60 per prescription for key medications.
attributes.additional_details:
This feels immoral to me on the NHS Business Authorities' part as it is NOT MY FAULT that I have a long term medical condition as it was something I was born with. Yet, people like me are having to suffer financially when the UK has a National Health Service which is supposed to help people like me! 

Please help me in my fight for fairness! Please grant medical exemption for paying for prescriptions to people with long term medical conditions such as cardiac problems!

attributes.action: Refund visa fees when rejected
attributes.background: We want the government to stop charging people for visas they do not receive. The current policy is to make the visa applicant pay for the visa upfront and then keep the money when the visa is refused. This is immoral, unjust and scandalous.
attributes.additional_details: My wife's visa was refused for financial reasons when I have earned £29,500 this year and the Home Office didn't believe it to be a genuine relationship when I have lived with her in Chile for 12 months and she has lived with me in the UK for 12 months. Considering the amount of money and time it takes to apply for a visa and the length of time an appeal will take the government should ask for further information if needed. The governments visa website is misleading and inaccurate.

attributes.action: Open a coroner's inquest for every stillborn baby.
attributes.background: In 2011 a midwife signed by baby off to receive a stillborn certificate. 7 years I have fought and in March this year the coroner found that my baby was NOT stillborn. He survived for 1hr10minutes, he suffered a neonatal death and should have received a Birth and Death certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
How many more families have/are going through this? How many babies could there be that have been wrongfully categorised as Stillborn?
We need to change the law so that every single baby who the midwives/doctors believe to be stillborn receives a coroner's inquest. If this was the case back in 2011 it would have saved our family 7 years of heartache. 
Now our son's birth will be registered and he will forever be on our family tree, he will never be forgotten, what every baby deserves.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to carry pillion passengers on a moped.
attributes.background: Let's put a stop to rising criminal offences including acid attacks, mobile phone theft, handbag theft and other crimes aided by mopeds which are far easier to carry out when carrying pillion passengers. Motorbikes over 50cc to be exempt.

attributes.action: Ban Mobile Phones on School Grounds
attributes.background: Our children are struggling at school. They are distracted by the thrill of social media via their mobile device. This must stop so why allow them to take the device onto school grounds?  If they have a problem at school, or we need to contact them urgently, we should go via the school office.
attributes.additional_details:
Not allowing them to take their devices to school would promote their conversational skills (they would be forced to talk to one another), allow them to focus more on their lessons, stop contact with parents during the day (we are busy with work and do not need the worry) and reduce online bullying.

It’s about time the UK Government woke up to this epidemic of device use at school and started to realise what effect it is having on the working force of tomorrow.  Let’s do something now!

attributes.action: Allow all people with vitamin D deficiency to receive free prescriptions.
attributes.background: A large section of the population will be affected due to the lack of sunshine and genetic make up. Vitamin D acts like a hormone and every cell in the body has a receptor for it, without it there are many symptoms and conditions that can occur.
attributes.additional_details: There are many conditions and symptoms of being Vitamin D deficient. Those with more melanin are at an instant disadvantage living in the UK. In order for these individuals to maintain their health, they have to bear the brunt of the cost and if they are to remain in the UK, this will be an expediture for thier lifetime. If a persons genetic make up renders them more vulnerable and this genetic make up exists within large sectors of the public, surely this should be handled as a social issue.

attributes.action: Introduce a South African Vulnerable Persons' Resettlement Programme
attributes.background:
- 1,700 people have been killed in farm attacks in two decades 
- In 2016/17 torture was used in 17.6% of murders 
- the South African Parliament decided in Feb to approve a motion in favour of “the expropriation of [white-owned] land without compensation”.
attributes.additional_details:
- In 2014 Britain established the Syrian Vulnerable Person Resettlement Programme (VPRP). Since June 2017 all those admitted to the UK under the VPRP have been granted refugee status. 
- We therefore merely call for equal treatment by the British government for South Africa.”

attributes.action: Lower the driving age to 15
attributes.background: Many students have to walk to school due to their families working or broken families. Result? many students get involved in alleyway gangs some can then skip school. If these students were allowed to drive they wouldn't get involved in drugs, but instead they wud be able to get to school and learn.

attributes.action: Make scoliosis screening compulsory in the UK
attributes.background: Many children and teens in the UK are suffering from scoliosis and have to receive surgery for it. If scoliosis screening is compulsory then they can find out that they have it earlier so it can be treated before it becomes so severe that surgery is the only answer.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to humanely kill and eat dogs in the UK.
attributes.background: The killing and eating of a dog is only illegal if the method of slaughter is deemed to have caused unnecessary suffering - otherwise eating the meat is still allowed in the UK. The government must make this a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Mandatory invisible disability signs to be displayed in highly populated areas
attributes.background: my son is 5 yrs old, non verbal autistic, who's behaviour can be hard and unpredictable at times, especially on public transport where we have had to explain his behaviour and rude comments made about him. physical disabilities don't have to be explained so why should invisible ones?
attributes.additional_details:
hidden and mental disabilities should be recognised equal to those with physical disabilities. no one should have to justify their actions because of their disability. signs should be put in restaurants, on public transport, in schools and play parks etc and any other public places with large volumes of people ...
stop people thinking children with additional needs are naughty by raising awareness.

attributes.action: Make 30 hours free child care available to all working parents including non-EU
attributes.background:
The conservative government introduced the 30 hours free child care to all working parents in 2016. This was a very welcomed news as it will help greatly with childcare costs.

I was greatly shocked to realise that we were NOT eligible for the 30hrs because of our immigration status(outside EEA).
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and my husband have been residents in this country for 9 years and we are both working, paying our taxes and NI. We are not entitled to public funds including child tax credit or child benefit.

It is UNFAIR that we get taxed as other working parents/ persons but we are denied the 30 hours free child care. This is harsh, unjust, unacceptable and discriminately. 


https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-brings-forward-plans-to-double-free-childcare-for-working-families

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for 14-16 year olds to learn working life skills in school
attributes.background: It should be a compulsory part of the national curruculum for all students between the ages of 14-16 to be taught how to create a basic household budget,how to apply for job vacancies,how to conduct themselves at interviews,how to keep documentation of job's they have applied for.
attributes.additional_details: Stated above are fundamental subjects that should be covered within the national curriculum,as they are crucial life skills that will prepare our young people for a sturdy working life. As a parent of a school leaver i am teaching my child these things,i have a huge interest in my child's past and future education,however not all parents are equipped with the knowledge to teach life skills to their children,so i believe making it a compulsory subject in schools is the best way forward.

attributes.action: Make an insurance on the car itself instead of the individuals who drive it
attributes.background: The insurance in many countries like Portugal, Poland or America is made on car itself instead of individuals who drive it. This would make it easier for everyone as people will be able to drive the car even if they are not its owner and will not pay huge amounts for borrowing it.
attributes.additional_details:
In the Portugal the road traffic fatalities are decreasing with each year as young people can learn to drive with their parents car. In the 2010, there was 937 road traffic fatalities and through 5 years it has decreased to 593.
Making this change in the country will allow people to save more money on the insurances and will allow young people to drive and learn on their parents car without buying separate insurance, which can cost a lot.
